steps.description: Customer enters postcode and the provider checks broadband availability and speed estimates.
steps.businessRationale: Address lookup is a critical entry step; delays cause immediate funnel abandonment in broadband journeys.

steps.description: Customer reviews available fibre packages, compares speeds, and selects a plan.
steps.businessRationale: Package comparison requires multiple API calls (pricing, speed tiers). Longer durations reduce conversion likelihood.

steps.description: Customer selects an installation date and confirms engineer availability.
steps.businessRationale: Engineer slot lookup is a high-latency backend process; availability failures directly block revenue.

steps.description: Customer enters personal details, sets up payment, and completes broadband order.
steps.businessRationale: Checkout is the highest-value step; payment latency or errors cause immediate revenue loss.

steps.description: Engineer completes installation and activates broadband service.
steps.businessRationale: Installation is a long operational step; delays impact customer satisfaction and churn risk.

steps.description: Customer uses broadband service; the provider tracks performance, usage, and early churn signals.
steps.businessRationale: First-month experience strongly predicts long-term retention; performance issues correlate with early churn.
